quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Book and Novel
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, seinfeld, books. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who wrote Uncle Toms Cabin, a book which was banned in most of the southern United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harriet Beecher Stowe

questions.question: This famous anti-war novel by Erik Marie Remarque was banned in Nazi Germany.

options.text: All Quiet on the Western Front

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All Quiet on the Western Front

questions.question: Who wrote the novel The Satanic Verses which was banned in Bangladesh, Iran, Singapore and Indonesia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salmon Rushdie

questions.question: During the missile crisis of the 1960s, this book was banned in the USA and the UK.

options.text: Down and Out in London and Paris

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1984

questions.question: In 1931 the Province of Hunan, China banned this book.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alices Adventures in Wonderland

questions.question: When the Nazis came to power they banned this short novel by Franz Kafka.

options.text: All Quiet on the Western Front

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Metamorphosis

questions.question: Who wrote the novel Dr. Zhivago which was banned in the Soviet Union until 1988?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boris Pasternak

questions.question: Which of these poems was written by Lord George Gordon Byron?

options.text: She Was A Phantom Of Delight

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She Walks In Beauty

questions.question: This work was banned in Lebanon for showing Jews, Zionism, and Israel in a favorable light.

options.text: The Diary of a Young  Girl

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Diary of a Young  Girl

questions.question: In Seinfeld, Jerry was accused of having this book overdue at the New York Public Library for over 15  years. It was banned in the USA from the 1930s until the 1950s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Tropic of Cancer

questions.question: Nadine Gordimer won the 1991 Nobel Prize in Literature but many of her works were banned in her  native country. What is her native country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Union of South Africa

questions.question: This book by D. H. Lawrence was banned in the USA, the UK and Australia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Chatterleys Lover

questions.question: This 18th century erotic novel is one of the most prosecuted and banned books in history.

options.text: Memoirs of a Woman of Pleasure

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Memoirs of a Woman of Pleasure

questions.question: This book, which was in part the basis for the play Pippin, was banned in the USA for obscenity.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Candide

questions.question: Many communities in California banned this Pulitzer Prize-winning novel and labeled it communist propaganda.

options.text: The Old Man and the Sea

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Grapes of Wrath

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Hans Christian Andersen and Break
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, deacons, hans. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what year did Edgar Allan Poe write the poem The City in the Sea?

options.text: Edgar Allan Poe never wrote The City in the Sea

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1831

questions.question: From which Hans Christian Andersens fairy tale are the characters Kai and Gerda?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Snow Queen

questions.question: What present did Hans Christian Andersen receive from King Frederick VI in 1833?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A traveling grant

questions.question: What was the name of Hans Christian Andersens first story which was published in 1822?

options.text: A Journey on Foot from Holmens Canal to the East Point of Amager

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ghost at Palnatokes Grave

questions.question: Which poet wrote the poem beginning with the words-Success is counted sweetest...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emily Dickinson

questions.question: Who wrote the poem Break, Break, Break?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

questions.question: What kind of literary works did Hans Christian Andersen enjoy reading when he was a child?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dramatic works

questions.question: Which of these poems was written by Lord Alfred Tennyson?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulysses

questions.question: Oliver Wendell Holmes wrote The Chambered Nautilus and The Deacons Masterpiece in the same year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these fairy tales by Hans Christian Andersen starts with a woman who longs to have a child and is given a magic seed by a witch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thumbelina

questions.question: Who is the author of the poems Meeting at Midnight and Parting in Morning?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Browning

questions.question: Hans Christian Andersen was born on April 2, 1805. What was his nationality?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Danish

questions.question: Victorian poets Elizabeth Browning and Robert Browning were brother and sister.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What unforgettable character from the novel David Copperfield by Charles Dickens is believed to be based on Hans Christian Andersens personality and appearance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Uriah Heep

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the childhood of Hans Christian Andersen?

options.text: He wasnt a very good student.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Wolves and Shakespearean
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, hans, priest. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What Shakespearean tragic heroine is advised by her father to lock herself from Hamlets resort?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ophelia

questions.question: Having survived a shipwreck, this character from the comedy Twelfth Night poses as a boy, named Cesario, and enters the service of Duke Orsino.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Viola

questions.question: In Calla Bryn Sturgis, in the book Wolves of the Calla, the ka-tet meet a priest who, together with most of the townsfolk, asks them to protect them against the Wolves. What is the priests name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Father Callahan

questions.question: The priest in the novel Wolves of the Calla has appeared previously in which Stephen King novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salems Lot

questions.question: Which Shakespearean heroine is not correctly matched with the play in which she appears?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Titania - Twelfth Night

questions.question: What Shakespearean character, who is the epitome of honesty and loyalty, is disinherited by her father, King Lear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cordelia

questions.question: How does young Juliet Capulet die in Shakespeares tragedy Romeo and Juliet?

options.text: She stabs herself with a dagger.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She stabs herself with a dagger.

questions.question: What Shakespearean heroine elopes with a man of a different race and later becomes an innocent victim of his wrath?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Desdemona

questions.question: The crystal ball in the novel Wolves of the Calla is used by Roland and his ka-tet to travel to 1977 to a borough of New York. Which Borough did they travel to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manhattan

questions.question: Which of these fairy tales by Hans Christian Andersen ends with the death of a poor girl in the streets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Little Match Girl

questions.question: In a sleepwalking scene, depicted in one of the most popular Shakespearean tragedies, this Queen of Scotland, suffering from a guilty conscience, cries Out, damned spot!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Macbeth

questions.question: What Shakespearean character is resented by her son for marrying her husbands brother, Claudius?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queen Gertrude

questions.question: In Shakespeares history play Richard III, this lady asked Richard, Did you not kill my husband? and got the following reply: Your beauty which did haunt me in my sleep could make me undertake the death of all the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Anne

questions.question: Name the headstrong and sharp-tongued woman whose feisty spirit is tamed by Petruccio in Shakespeares comedy The Taming of the Shrew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katherina (Kate)

questions.question: In the harbor of Copenhagen there is a statue of this enchanting character created by Hans Christian Andersen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Little Mermaid

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Wolves and Poem
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, people, parts. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This  type of  poem is usually a long poem that tells the story of a significant event or a significant persons life.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Epic Poetry

questions.question: This type of poem is one that is relatively short and tells a story.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Narrative poem

questions.question: The Wolves in the novel The Wolves of the Calla have an arsenal of weapons, including hand-grenades called what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sneetches

questions.question: In the novel Wolves of the Calla, Roland and the ka-tet team travelled to New York to protect what?

options.text: Eddies brother, Henry, from a drug dealer
The headquarters of the Tet Corporation
Prevent Jake from being killed by Jack Mort
A single red rose growing in a vacant lot

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A single red rose growing in a vacant lot

questions.question: Susannah begins to undergo yet another change of character in Wolves of the Calla. What is this characters name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mia

questions.question: Why are the Wolves such a problem to the people of Calla Bryn Sturgis in the novel Wolves of the Calla?

options.text: They always beat the Bryn Sturgis soccer team when they visit.
They come down from the mountains and kill all of the sheep, which are the main livestock in the area.
They abduct one twin of a pair from a family whenever they appear.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They abduct one twin of a pair from a family whenever they appear.

questions.question: In this type of poem, the first letters of each line help give the meaning of the poem.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Acrostic

questions.question: In which book by Mark Twain does the following phrase appear:  Lead us into temptation?

options.text: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthurs Court

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Man That Corrupted Hadleyburg

questions.question: This type of poem consists of 14 lines with this rhyme pattern: abba cddc effe gg
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sonnet

questions.question: Which word means a set of two lines in a poem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: couplet

questions.question: This expression means an audible pause that breaks up a line of poetry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Caesura

questions.question: This is a type of Japanese poem that is made of three parts; the first has five syllables, the second seven and the third have five.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Haiku

questions.question: When the priest first appeared near Calla Bryn Sturgis in the book Wolves of the Calla, he was found by a religious group. What is their name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manni

questions.question: This is a type of Chinese poetry .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jintishi

questions.question: This  type of poem is typified by a great poem by Omar Khayyam
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rubiyat

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Book and Mark Twain
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, halleys, papas. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This poet wrote the poems Moss Gathering and My Papas Waltz in 1948 and Elegy for Jane in 1953.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Theodore Roethke

questions.question: What Mark Twain book is the following quote from: Tom lost his temper.  I notice a person most always does that’s got laid out in an argument. He told us to shut up.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Sawyer Abroad

questions.question: Which poet wrote the poems The Germ, Listen, A Word to Husbands, and Very Like a Whale?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ogden Nash

questions.question: Gwendolyn Brooks wrote all of the following poems except one. Can you find the odd one out?

options.text: The Ballad of Sue Ellen Westerfield
The Chicago Defender Sends A Man To Little Rock

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ballad of Sue Ellen Westerfield

questions.question: Which of these poems was not written by Robert Lowell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Digging for China

questions.question: The difference between a cat and a lie is that the cat only has nine lives. Which book by Mark Twain is this quote from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pudd nhead Willson

questions.question: All of these poems were written by Allen Ginsberg except one. Which one was written by poet James Dickey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Beholders

questions.question: What book by Mark Twain does this quote come from: In mans heaven...it shall contain each and every thing that is repulsive to a man, and not a single thing he likes....it pays no compliment to the intellect...in fact never even mentions it. ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Letters From the Earth

questions.question: I came in with Halleys Comet...it will be the greatest disappointment of my life if I dont go out with it. is a quote from what book by Mark Twain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Autobiography of Mark Twain

questions.question: What Mark Twain book is the following line from: All right, then, Ill go to hell!?

options.text: The Diary of Adam and Eve

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Huckleberry Finn

questions.question: Which of the following poems was not written by C. Day Lewis?

options.text: Come, Live With Me And Be My Love

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Unknown Citizen

questions.question: What book does the following quote come from: You dont know me without you have read a book by the name of The Adventures of Tom Sawyer, but that aint no matter. ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Huckleberry Finn

questions.question: What book by Mark Twain is the following excerpt from: If man could be crossed with a cat - it would improve man - but it would deteriorate the cat.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Autobiography of Mark Twain

questions.question: From which Mark Twain book does the following line come: “I never felt so filled with a blessed peace as I did yesterday - when I learned that Michangelo was dead.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Innocents Abroad

questions.question: I wish I owned half of that dog.  Why? somebody asked.  Because I would kill my half is a conversation from what book by Mark Twain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Puddnhead Wilson

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: John Steinbeck and Book
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, john, massachusetts. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Name the sequel to John Steinbecks 1945 book Cannery Row.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sweet Thursday

questions.question: During World War II John Steinbeck worked as a war correspondent for this newspaper.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York Herald Tribune

questions.question: In 1960 John Steinbeck set off on a trip around America, which he described in a book. What name did Steinbeck give to the vehicle he used during the trip?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rocinante

questions.question: He graduated from Harvard in 1916. He wrote The Enormous Room (1922) about a prison camp during WWI.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: e.e. cummings

questions.question: He is largely considered to be the most popular American poet of the 19th century as well as the first professional American poet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

questions.question: What prize did John Steinbeck receive in 1962?

options.text: New York Drama Critics Circle Award
Commonwealth Club of California Gold Medal for Best Novel by a Californian

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nobel Prize for Literature

questions.question: Upon its publishing in 1939 this book by John Steinbeck was banned from public schools and libraries in a lot of places in America.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Grapes of Wrath

questions.question: She was born in 1830 in Amherst, Massachusetts, and bore the same first name as her mother.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emily Dickinson

questions.question: Which 20th century poet wrote the phrase Candy is Dandy, But Liquor is Quicker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ogden Nash

questions.question: Which of the following women was not married to John Steinbeck?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Steinbeck Dekker

questions.question: Which of the following books by John Steinbeck won a Pulitzer prize?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Grapes of Wrath

questions.question: George Milton and Lennie Small were characters in which book by John Steinbeck?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Of Mice and Men

questions.question: What was John Steinbecks first published novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cup of Gold

questions.question: Which poet wrote the poems Still I Rise, I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings, and Remembrance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maya Angelou

questions.question: John Steinbeck was born in 1902 in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salinas, California
